text:
In this video, you’ll see how to 
enable purchase order entry for
Software as a Service (SaaS) contracts in AWS Marketplace.

With this capability, you can enter PO numbers 
for SaaS contract product subscriptions,

improve visibility of SaaS contract 
 subscriptions in the AWS Billing console,

and easily attribute AWS Marketplace 
invoices to approved purchase orders.

To get started, let’s navigate to 
the AWS Marketplace settings in our

management account, where 
we are already logged in.

To enable PO entry for Marketplace SaaS 
contracts, we’ll need to enable the AWS Billing
service-linked role and integrate it into our account.
This is a one-time setup step.

Note the green checkbox, which indicates 
the service linked role is created.

Now, all users within your organization 
with the appropriate subscribe permissions,

can add purchase order numbers 
for SaaS Contract transactions.

Next, we’ll find the product 
we want to subscribe to.
Let’s configure our contract details.

We’ll set this contract to run for 
12 months with no auto renewal.
Next, we’ll specify our desired options.

In this case, we’ll have 1 unit for Fargate 
monitoring and 1 unit for Analyzed Logs.

Now that the contract is configured, 
we can enter our unique PO number here.

By adding the PO number at the point 
of transaction within AWS Marketplace,

we can ensure that the resulting AWS invoices reflect 
the specific PO number for the approved transaction.
The PO number is also automatically viewable within the

Purchase Order Management Console 
for future reference and tracking.
Let’s create the contract and subscribe.
Now that we’ve subscribed, let’s navigate to the
AWS Billing Console and find the PO for this subscription.

Because we entered a PO number when we initiated 
the transaction, we can easily locate the purchase

order ID in the Console. Let’s drill down 
to view the details of the purchase order.

We can take a closer look at the 
line item using the edit option.

You’ve just seen how to enable PO entry 
for SaaS Contracts in AWS Marketplace.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it's your turn to try.
